summary: This is an email from an FBI Special Agent in New York to Amazon's criminal subpoena email address, following up on an unreturned subpoena related to case CRIM1031692 2019 DS. The email, sent on July 24, 2019, references an earlier follow-up from July 9, 2019, and includes an attachment of the original subpoena dated June 24, 2019.

persons.name: SA FBI New York
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent from New York is the sender of the email, following up on an unreturned subpoena issued to Amazon for case CRIM1031692 2019 DS.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Amazon
events.description: A subpoena was issued to Amazon by the FBI as part of case CRIM1031692 2019 DS, with a return requested by July 5, 2019.

events.title: First Status Check on Subpoena
events.description: The FBI Special Agent sent a first follow-up email to Amazon to check the status of the subpoena return, which was overdue.

events.title: Second Follow-up on Unreturned Subpoena
events.description: The FBI Special Agent sent a second, high-importance email to Amazon, noting no response had been received and attaching the original subpoena.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating case CRIM1031692 2019 DS, which appears to be related to human trafficking given the VCAC/Human Trafficking unit reference.
A subpoena was issued to Amazon on or before June 24, 2019, with a requested return date of July 5, 2019.
As of July 24, 2019, Amazon had not responded to the subpoena, prompting multiple follow-ups from the FBI.
The communication indicates the FBI was seeking data or records from Amazon as part of a criminal investigation in mid-2019.
